channel.title: BBC News

item.title: France's far right celebrates lead and seeks majority
item.description: National Rally is in pole position for a historic election victory and stands at the gates of power.

item.title: Energy prices fall but relief may be temporary
item.description: A new price cap from energy regulator Ofgem takes effect but bills are likely to rise again before winter.

item.title: Analysis: France's far right now dominant political force
item.description: The right-wing National Rally is projected to top the first vote - but all is still to play for.

item.title: Reform candidate defects to Tories over racism row
item.description: Liam Booth-Isherwood ditches his campaign citing "reports of racism" in the party.

item.title: SZA’s striking set failed to set Glastonbury alight
item.description: The US R&B star shone, but drew the smallest-ever audience for a headline set on the Pyramid Stage.

item.title: UK planning laws deter investment, says drugs giant
item.description: Dave Ricks says he had considered building a factory in the UK, but chose another country instead.

item.title: Banksy posts clip of raft stunt at Glastonbury
item.description: The artist used an unsuspecting band at Glastonbury Festival to launch his latest performance.

item.title: More wounded Palestinians tell BBC the Israeli army forced them on to jeep
item.description: Two more Palestinian men tell the BBC they were shot and forced on to the bonnet of an Israeli jeep.

item.title: Taylor Swift personal items to be displayed at V&A
item.description: Cowboy boots, dresses, music awards and storyboards will be included in the collection.

item.title: Jay Slater's family vow to continue search
item.description: The Spanish police search for Jay Slater ends, but his family and friends maintain their efforts.

item.title: Caribbean braces as Hurricane Beryl strengthens
item.description: Caribbean islands are preparing for the arrival of an increasingly powerful storm from Sunday night.

item.title: Allies defend Biden as poll suggests growing age concern
item.description: According to the poll, 72% of registered voters believe Mr Biden is not mentally fit enough to serve as president.

item.title: From 'Iceland vibes' to 'get-out-of-jail-free card'
item.description: At half-time in England's game against Slovakia there were "Iceland vibes" and, even at the end, "Sweet Caroline didn't sound very sweet" - but the Three Lions are in a fourth quarter-final in a row under Gareth Southgate.

item.title: 'Bellingham goal will go down in England history'
item.description: Jude Bellingham pulled Gareth Southgate's side clear of the precipice with one of the finest goals scored by anyone in an England shirt, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: Bellingham rescues England with injury-time overhead kick
item.description: Watch as Jude Bellingham scores a stunning injury-time goal to send England in to extra time against Slovakia in the Euro 2024 last-16 match at Gelsenkirchen.

item.title: Watch England fans go wild as Bellingham scores late equaliser
item.description: Watch England fans erupt at a fanpark in Wembley as Jude Bellingham scores a late stunner to send the game to extra time against Slovakia in the Euro 2024 last-16 match in Gelsenkirchen.

item.title: Switzerland next on the BBC - England's path in Euros
item.description: BBC Sport takes a look at England's possible routes through the Euro 2024 knockout stage.

item.title: 'A story of human trafficking, hope and love'
item.description: Nico Williams has been one of Spain's standout players at Euro 2024. BBC Sport looks at his remarkable journey to the top.

item.title: We would do anything to protect this manager - Rice
item.description: Midfielder Declan Rice says England's players would "do anything to protect" under-fire manager Gareth Southgate after they booked a last-eight meeting with Switzerland in dramatic fashion.

item.title: 'Deepfake' Southgate videos viewed by millions
item.description: The Football Association criticises AI-generated videos on social media purporting to show Gareth Southgate making crude remarks about England players.

item.title: 'French right humiliates Macron' and 'Saved by the Bell'
item.description: Monday's papers focus on the first round of elections in France and England's tense performance at the Euros on Sunday.

item.title: I recognised my sister in video of refugees captured in Sudan war
item.description: Eritreans tell the BBC their relatives are being detained incommunicado by Sudan's military.

item.title: Steve Bannon says 'Maga army' ready, as he reports to prison
item.description: Former top Trump adviser tells BBC he is unconcerned about missing crucial campaign period while he sits behind bars.

item.title: Avril Lavigne on waiting 22 years to play Glastonbury
item.description: The 39-year-old Canadian singer performed at the festival as part of her greatest hits tour.

item.title: Empty caves, dead ends, and a vast landscape - how Jay Slater search unfolded
item.description: Almost two weeks after the 19-year-old was last seen, the search has now been called off.

item.title: Affordable home families hit by 450% gas price rise
item.description: About 1,000 residents in Edinburgh see a huge jump in their heating bills.

item.title: Five Wimbledon storylines to look out for
item.description: Raducanu returns, Draper looks to pick up Murray's baton, and more key things to watch out for when Wimbledon starts on Monday.

item.title: Who should I vote for and what are the parties promising?
item.description: Explore the manifestos of the main parties in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland and compare their policies on key issues with this interactive guide.

item.title: PM insists UK better place to live now than in 2010
item.description: The PM says Coivd and the Ukraine war made things "difficult" but the UK was "on the right track".

item.title: How do the parties compare?
item.description: How do people say they will vote in the UK general election? Our poll tracker measures the trends.

item.title: SNP would work with Labour to boost migration to Scotland
item.description: SNP leader John Swinney says a UK-wide approach will not address Scotland's skills shortages.

item.title: Sir John Curtice: Tories still behind Labour... in 60 seconds
item.description: With four days to go until election day, the Tories are still behind Labour by 20 points.

item.title: Could Labour 'stop the boats'?
item.description: Labour wouldn’t send asylum seekers to Rwanda, but can their alternative plan hope to stop the boats?

item.title: Has frantic election campaign actually grappled with massive issues UK faces?
item.description: There's been drama galore over the past month - but have our politicians really addressed the crucial issues facing the country?

item.title: How much weight do NI party manifestos really carry?
item.description: BBC NI's political editor Enda McClafferty looks at how effective manifestos are in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Key takeaways from Green and Reform leaders' Question Time
item.description: Adrian Ramsay and Nigel Farage are pressed by the audience on their candidates, tax and the US election.

item.title: Is this really the TikTok general election?
item.description: Snarky jibes and silly memes have been a hit on TikTok but the real social battle is elsewhere.

item.title: What are the parties saying about women's rights and gender identity?
item.description: Party leaders have been asked about where they stand on the topic of single-sex spaces.

item.title: Why do politicians keep talking about locks?
item.description: The 2024 election campaign has seen further growth in British politicians' favourite metaphor.

item.title: Ramsay on Green's immigration plan and electric car timescale
item.description: Green Party co-leader was asked on BBC Question Time about migration and the switch from petrol cars.

item.title: Farage on Reform's candidate controversies and immigration policy
item.description: The party's leader was asked on BBC Question Time about the selection of candidates for his party, and role of immigration in the UK.

item.title: Who can I vote for in the general election?
item.description: Find out which constituency you are in, who you can vote for and where you can vote using our postcode search.

item.title: What election issues really matter to you? Let us know
item.description: At BBC News, we need your help to ensure we’re getting our election coverage right.

item.title: Sunak v Starmer: Watch key moments from final pre-election head-to-head
item.description: There were combative exchanges during the last leaders' debate ahead of the general election.

item.title: Chris Mason: Debates done - next the election sprint begins
item.description: With the election finish line nearing, the vast lead Labour has in the polls over the Tories hasn’t budged.

item.title: Hugh Pym: Is sugar the missing ingredient in election manifestos?
item.description: Sugar taxes have been widely debated but in party manifestos, the word "sugar" barely appears. Why?

item.title: How does Labour want to tackle poverty?
item.description: The political parties have been laying out how they would address poverty.

item.title: This city is worried about immigration, but who has the solution?
item.description: In Peterborough, Ed Thomas hears voters' concerns about social cohesion and pressure on public services.

item.title: Will there be more air travel chaos this summer?
item.description: Air travel is booming, but last year delays were much worse than pre-pandemic. Will 2024 be the same?

item.title: Charge over alleged inmate and officer sex video
item.description: The Met Police said it began an investigation "after officers were made aware of a video".

item.title: Electronic music star bringing new life to Jeremy Clarkson's farm
item.description: Andy Cato, the musician turned regenerative farmer, has won over Clarkson's Farm and its audience.

item.title: Suspected female suicide bombers kill at least 18 in Nigeria
item.description: A wedding, the funeral of those killed there as well as a hospital were targeted in a series of attacks.

item.title: Russell wins Austrian GP after late Norris-Verstappen collision
item.description: George Russell wins the Austrian Grand Prix after a collision between Max Verstappen and Lando Norris while they were fighting for the lead.

item.title: Why parents are locking themselves in cells at Korean 'happiness factory'
item.description: Some South Koreans are spending time in a cell to try to understand their socially isolated children.

item.title: 'I got a first look inside the royal rooms at Balmoral Castle'
item.description: A new tour of Balmoral Castle for members of the public starts on Monday.

item.title: Dua Lipa reminisces on her Glastonbury journey
item.description: Global pop sensation Dua Lipa explores her Glastonbury journey.

item.title: SZA's greatest hits and moments at the BBC
item.description: 1Xtra celebrates R&B superstar SZA!

item.title: 'Who else? Iconic Bellingham goal will go down in England history'
item.description: Jude Bellingham pulled Gareth Southgate's side clear of the precipice with one of the finest goals scored by anyone in an England shirt, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: From 'Iceland vibes' to 'get-out-of-jail-free card'
item.description: At half-time in England's game against Slovakia there were "Iceland vibes" and, even at the end, "Sweet Caroline didn't sound very sweet" - but the Three Lions are in a fourth quarter-final in a row under Gareth Southgate.

item.title: Bellingham's last-gasp equaliser - All the angles
item.description: Watch every angle of Jude Bellingham's last gasp injury-time equaliser as England advance to the Euro 2024 quarter-final after beating Slovakia in the last 16 match at Gelsenkirchen.

item.title: 'A little bit desperate' - Norris fumes at Verstappen move
item.description: Lando Norris accuses Max Verstappen, his friend and now closest rival, of driving that was “a little bit desperate”, after a battle at the Austrian GP.

item.title: Highlights: England edge past Slovakia in extra time
item.description: Jude Bellingham and Harry Kane score as England progress to the Euro 2024 quarter-finals by beating Slovakia in extra time in Gelsenkirchen.

item.title: Download now
item.description: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

item.title: Watch continuing coverage of the election campaigns
item.description: Continuing coverage of the 2024 General Election Campaign, from BBC News

item.title: Sunak and Labour's Final Sunday Pitch
item.description: The PM and Labour’s campaign chief are in Laura’s BBC One studio

item.title: All aboard the Election Express
item.description: All aboard the Election Express! Passengers sound off on the issues that matter to them.

item.title: How much are gas and electricity bills falling?
item.description: Under the new price cap, the cost of electricity and gas will drop from 1 July.

item.title: When will mortgage rates come down?
item.description: Bank of England interest rates affect mortgage, loan and savings rates for millions of people.

item.title: Debt relief orders can write off up to £50,000
item.description: The maximum amount that can be written off by a debt relief order has gone up from £30,000 to £50,000.

item.title: How much are prices rising for you? Try our calculator
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much the cost of living is going up in your household.

item.title: What are my rights if my flight is cancelled or delayed?
item.description: If you face disruption because flights are cancelled or delayed, then what can you do?

item.title: How quickly are prices rising in the UK?
item.description: The rate at which prices are rising has fallen from record highs, meeting the 2% target.

item.title: How much is child benefit worth and who can claim it?
item.description: Changes announced in the Budget mean people earning up to £80,000 can get the benefit.

item.title: Students' Nazi song video branded reprehensible
item.description: "Troubling" footage appears to show some University of Warwick students singing a WW2 marching song.

item.title: Damage to new-build homes 'sectarian hate crime'
item.description: One of the homes was occupied at the time of the attack, police say.

item.title: SNP would work with Labour to boost migration to Scotland
item.description: SNP leader John Swinney says a UK-wide approach will not address Scotland's skills shortages.

item.title: Ex-Olympian among first-time election candidates
item.description: Marc Jenkins said he had a "massive case of imposter syndrome" when applying to become a candidate.
